quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Wild Wild West and Jim West
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, summer, villain. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How did Jim West and Artemus Gordon travel around the country on the TV show The Wild Wild West?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Private Train

questions.question: Robert Conrad did his own stunts on the TV show The Wild Wild West.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Twiggy was named the “The Face of 1966” by Vogue.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Who portrayed Jim West partner, Artemus Gordon on The Wild Wild West?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ross Martin

questions.question: In the summer of 2000, beauty company Olay started its Definity Eye Cream campaign depicting Twiggy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Why was the show The Wild Wild West cancelled?

options.text: CBS canceled the show because of the violence.
Robert Conrad got tired of the show.
The show wasnt as good without Ross Martin.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: CBS canceled the show because of the violence.

questions.question: Audie Murphys parents were sharecroppers from Texas.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In which 1990s TV series did Twiggy appear?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Princesses

questions.question: Who played Jim West was on the TV show The Wild Wild West?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Conrad

questions.question: There were very few fight scenes on the show The Wild Wild West.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This Wild Wild West villain was a dwarf.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dr. Miguelito Loveless

questions.question: Which of these models was Twiggys greatest influence?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jean Shrimpton

questions.question: Twiggy appeared in this comedy starring Robin Williams.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Club Paradise

questions.question: Where did Jim West carry his derringer on the TV show The Wild Wild West?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: up his sleeve

questions.question: Artemus Gordon was in disguise in most Wild Wild West episodes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Memorial Day and War
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, john, bugle. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What was the occupation of Nora Fontaine Davidson who is regarded as the inspiration for the US Memorial Day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: schoolteacher

questions.question: At what time does the National Moment of Remembrance take place on Memorial Day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 3 p.m

questions.question: Arlington National Cemetery was established during the American Civil War on the grounds of the estate which once belonged to Mary Anna Custis family. Whose wife was Mary Anna Custis?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert E. Lees

questions.question: Known as the Poppy Lady, this U.S. professor and humanitarian conceived the idea of wearing poppies as a symbol of remembrance for those who served in World War I.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Moina Michael

questions.question: What Union general is credited with composing the bugle call Taps, which is sounded on Memorial Day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Daniel Butterfield

questions.question: Memorial Day was first enacted to honor soldiers who died in what war?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Civil War

questions.question: Who was the founder of Sikhism?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nanak Dev

questions.question: What US President presided over the entombment of the Unknown Soldier of World War II and the Unknown Soldier of the Korean War?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dwight D. Eisenhower

questions.question: Franklin Sousley, Harlon Block, and Michael Strank, who were immortalized in an iconic photo by Joe Rosenthal, were killed during what WWII battle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Battle of Iwo Jima

questions.question: What statement is true about General John Logan, national commander of the Grand Army of the Republic?

options.text: He issued a proclamation that Decoration Day be observed nationwide.
He wrote the poem In Flanders Fields.
He introduced measures to return Memorial Day to its traditional date, 30 May.
He refused to celebrate Decoration Day, due to lingering hostility towards the Confederate Army.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He issued a proclamation that Decoration Day be observed nationwide.

questions.question: What was the original name of the US federal holiday known as Memorial Day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Decoration Day

questions.question: In Arlington National Cemetery there is a small memorial which commemorates the veterans of the Secret War. Which war conflict does the term Secret War refer to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Laotian Civil War

questions.question: At the beginning of this 1998 epic war movie, an elderly World War II veteran and his family visit the Normandy American Cemetery and Memorial in France.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Saving Private Ryan

questions.question: What village was designated as the official birthplace of Memorial Day by President Lyndon B. Johnson?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Waterloo, New York

questions.question: What notable memorial war poem was written by Canadian poet and physician Lieutenant Colonel John McCrae?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In Flanders Fields
